title: Settings
description: Main settings interface for the application

properties.name: name
properties.description:
A preset theme configuration that changes the look and feel of the project.
A theme is a set of default styling configurations.

Example built-in themes: 
`cosmo`
, 
`gusto`
, 
`poetry`
, 
`picasso`

properties.name: markdown
properties.description: Markdown configuration for the theme, including options like syntax highlighting

properties.name: logo
properties.description:
Path to logo image or object with path to "light" and "dark" mode logo images, and where the logo links to.
SVG format is recommended as it does not pixelate and the file size is generally smaller.

properties.name: light
properties.description:
Path to the logo in light mode. For example: 
`/path/to/logo.svg`

properties.name: dark
properties.description:
Path to the logo in dark mode. For example: 
`/path/to/logo.svg`

properties.name: href
properties.description: Where clicking on the logo links you to

properties.name: favicon
properties.description: Path to the favicon image. For example: /path/to/favicon.svg

properties.name: maxTocDepth
properties.description: The defult level of the table of contents.

properties.name: noprefix
properties.description: Merge icons from the library into the default iconify library

properties.name: sidebar
properties.description: Definition of sidebar - an array of groups with all the pages within that group

properties.name: pages
properties.description:
The relative paths to the markdown files that will serve as pages.
Note: groups are recursive, so to add a sub-folder add another group object in the page array.

properties.name: pages
properties.description:
The relative paths to the markdown files that will serve as pages.
Note: groups are recursive, so to add a sub-folder add another group object in the page array.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: The sort order of the group.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: The sort order of the group.

properties.name: pages
properties.description:
The relative paths to the markdown files that will serve as pages.
Note: groups are recursive, so to add a sub-folder add another group object in the page array.

properties.name: pages
properties.description:
The relative paths to the markdown files that will serve as pages.
Note: groups are recursive, so to add a sub-folder add another group object in the page array.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: The sort order of the group.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: The sort order of the group.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The url once you click on the button

properties.name: float
properties.description: Float the header to the right

properties.name: url
properties.description: The url once you click on the button

properties.name: float
properties.description: Float the header to the right

properties.name: anchors
properties.description: Anchors, includes the icon, name, and url

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the anchor label

properties.name: url
properties.description:
The start of the URL that marks what pages go in the anchor.
Generally, this is the name of the folder you put your pages in.

ofProperty.description: API file configuration. Can be a path, an array of paths, a map of paths, or an advanced configuration

properties.name: baseUrl
properties.description:
The base url for all API endpoints. If baseUrl is an array, it will enable
for multiple base url options that the user can toggle.

properties.name: method
properties.description: The authentication strategy used for all API endpoints

properties.name: name
properties.description:
The name of the authentication parameter used in the API playground.
If method is basic, the format should be [usernameName]:[passwordName]

properties.name: inputPrefix
properties.description:
The default value that's designed to be a prefisx for the authentication input field.
E.g. If an inputPrefix of AuthKey would inherit the default input result of the authentication field as AuthKey.

properties.name: example
properties.description: Configurations for the auto-generated API request examples

properties.name: languages
properties.description:
An array of strings that determine the order of the languages of the auto-generated request examples.
You can either define custom languages utilizing x-codeSamples or use our default languages which include
bash, python, javascript, php, go, java

ofProperty.description: API file configuration. Can be a path, an array of paths, a map of paths, or an advanced configuration

properties.name: analytics
properties.description:
Configurations to add third-party analytics integrations.
See full list of supported analytics here.

properties.name: search
properties.description:
Configurations to add third-party search integrations.
See full list of supported search here.

properties.name: paths
properties.description: Path aliases for imports. Avoid long relative paths by creating shortcuts.

properties.name: store
properties.description:
If 
`true`
 then virtual pages will not created and generated content will be stored on disk
